## Code Review Checklist
<!-- This checklist will be used by reviewers. Do not remove items. -->

### Code Quality
- [ ] Code follows Java and Spring Boot best practices
- [ ] Code is clean, readable, and well-documented
- [ ] No code duplication exists
- [ ] Proper naming conventions followed
- [ ] Error handling is appropriate

### Testing
- [ ] All new methods have appropriate unit tests
- [ ] Test coverage is adequate (>80%)
- [ ] Edge cases are tested
- [ ] Tests follow Arrange-Act-Assert pattern

### Security
- [ ] Input validation is implemented
- [ ] No security vulnerabilities introduced
- [ ] Sensitive data is not exposed in logs
- [ ] Authentication/authorization properly implemented (if applicable)

### Performance
- [ ] No obvious performance issues
- [ ] Database queries are optimized
- [ ] Proper indexing considered (if applicable)
- [ ] Resource management is appropriate

### API & Architecture
- [ ] API endpoints follow RESTful conventions (if applicable)
- [ ] Proper HTTP status codes used
- [ ] DTOs separate API contracts from domain models
- [ ] Separation of concerns maintained

### Documentation
- [ ] Code is properly commented where needed
- [ ] Javadoc added for public APIs
- [ ] README updated if necessary
- [ ] API documentation updated if applicable
